definition: Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: II. In case the gas quantity of users are reduced in breach of the provisions of contracts.
sentences.chinese: 不按合同規定，自行減少或剋扣用戶氣量。

sentences.english: He is a miser,and has penny-pinched himself out of several millions of US dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他是個吝嗇鬼，剋扣自己而攢下數百萬美元。

sentences.english: The workers also claimed that the factory has failed to issue pension payments.
sentences.chinese: 工人還聲稱工廠剋扣社會保險金。

sentences.english: People might try to use "the economy" as an excuse to shortchange you this week.
sentences.chinese: 人們可能會試圖用“經濟”爲藉口，剋扣你這個星期。

sentences.english: I surely got beaten when I bought rice from a monger.
sentences.chinese: 我從商販子那裏買的米，肯定被剋扣了分量。

sentences.english: Her salary was cut short by her boss without any excuse.
sentences.chinese: 她的工資無端被老闆剋扣。

sentences.english: He is a deceitful cook who skimps on ingredients and shortchanges guests.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個剋扣配料，欺騙客人的不老實的廚師。

sentences.english: The soldiers lost their will to fight when the general secretly reduced their allowance.
sentences.chinese: 由於將軍私自剋扣餉銀，士兵們幾乎沒什麼鬥志。
